alert.note: Alert for Bosque (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 26 at 4:46PM CDT until April 26 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL BOSQUE COUNTY... At 445 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located just north of Meridian, or 12 miles northwest of Clifton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over central Bosque County, which includes Morgan. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
